derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Spanish patata, variant of Taino batata 'sweet potato'. The English word originally denoted the sweet potato and gained its current sense in the late 16th cent

encyclopedia.content: 英语单词 n.[C] 1.马铃薯，土豆，洋芋 2.甘薯，山芋，白薯 3.【英口】（袜子上的）破洞 4.【澳俚】姑娘，女人 5.(potatoes)【美俚】钱 复 数：potatoes 同义词 [n.] irish potato, murphy, solanum tuberosum, white potato 相关短语 potato chip n. 炸土豆片 sweet potato 白薯，甘薯，山芋 white potato n.白马铃薯，土豆 potato bean 利马豆，菜豆 potato beetle 马铃薯瓢虫 potato blight 马铃薯晚疫病 potato bug 马铃薯瓢虫

entry.def: Potatoes are quite round vegetables with brown or red skins and white insides. They grow under the ground.

entry.tran: 棘手的问题；烫手山芋；意见不一的复杂问题
entry.def: You can refer to a difficult subject that people disagree on as a hot potato .

example.ex: ...a political hot potato such as abortion.
example.tran: 类似堕胎这样政治上的烫手山芋

means.word_mean: 1. an edible tuber native to South America; a staple food of Ireland
2. annual native to South America having underground stolons bearing edible starchy tubers; widely cultivated as a garden vegetable; vines are poisonous

example.en: He kissed her on the potato-trap.
example.zh: 他亲了亲她的嘴。 potbelly (= potgut)

example.en: Everyone in her family has a potbelly.
example.zh: 她家人人都是大腹便便的。

jushi.english: A potato consists mainly of starch.

jushi.english: Eastern Brazilians lean more heavily on the sweet potato.
